DataElement.preferredName: Disease or Disorder FIGO Staging System and Modified World Health Organization [WHO] Prognostic Scoring System for Gestational Trophoblastic Neoplasms CancerSite Diagnosis Score
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function._A system for defining prognosis for gestational trophoblastic neoplasia. In this system, the FIGO stage is represented by an Roman numeral, followed by the modified WHO score depicted as an Arabic numeral and separated by a colon (e.g., Stage II:4, Stage IV:9). Scores of 0-6 are considered low-risk and scores greater than 6 are considered high-risk._class to hold instances used as the filler for the property has_cancer_site_The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation._A system for defining prognosis for gestational trophoblastic neoplasia. In this system, the FIGO stage is represented by an Roman numeral, followed by the modified WHO score depicted as an Arabic numeral and separated by a colon (e.g., Stage II:4, Stage IV:9). Scores of 0-6 are considered low-risk and scores greater than 6 are considered high-risk._class to hold instances used as the filler for the property has_cancer_site_A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A definite pathologic process with a characteristic set of signs and symptoms. It may affect the whole body or any of its parts, and its etiology, pathology, and prognosis may be known or unknown.

Concepts.definition: Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

Property.preferredName: FIGO Staging System and Modified World Health Organization [WHO] Prognostic Scoring System for Gestational Trophoblastic Neoplasms CancerSite Diagnosis
Property.preferredDefinition: A system for defining prognosis for gestational trophoblastic neoplasia. In this system, the FIGO stage is represented by an Roman numeral, followed by the modified WHO score depicted as an Arabic numeral and separated by a colon (e.g., Stage II:4, Stage IV:9). Scores of 0-6 are considered low-risk and scores greater than 6 are considered high-risk.:class to hold instances used as the filler for the property has_cancer_site:The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.

Concepts.longName: FIGO Staging System and Modified World Health Organization [WHO] Prognostic Scoring System for Gestational Trophoblastic Neoplasms
Concepts.definition: A system for defining prognosis for gestational trophoblastic neoplasia. In this system, the FIGO stage is represented by an Roman numeral, followed by the modified WHO score depicted as an Arabic numeral and separated by a colon (e.g., Stage II:4, Stage IV:9). Scores of 0-6 are considered low-risk and scores greater than 6 are considered high-risk.
class to hold instances used as the filler for the property has_cancer_site

The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.
